content:
Manufacturers provide instruction manuals to guide customers through the setup and usage process. These manuals may appear long, tedious, and boring to some, but they contain essential information necessary for the equipment's proper use, maintenance, and safety. They may also come in multiple languages, adding further to the length.

Manufacturers make every effort to ensure that the instruction manual is as comprehensive and detailed as possible to help users understand the process. It is ultimately up to the user to dedicate the necessary time and effort to read and comprehend the manual.

If you're finding the manual challenging to follow, consider reaching out to the manufacturer's customer support for further assistance. Some manufacturers provide a phone number or chat support to help answer questions or resolve issues with their products. With a little patience and perseverance, you can successfully follow the instruction manual and set up your equipment professionally.
